instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Board had mild water damage. All components were replaced that had corrosion, smc was reflowed and board went in uc afterwards. It worked for a few minutes and then died.

Currently I have a green light and all power rails up to pp5v3_s3 is missing. I already checked and replaced u7200. pin 16 is 16v. what should I check next?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Exact PPBUS voltage? Voltage on C1802/03?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Crap under SMC still likely. Make sure it is not power cycling at all on 5V_S3!

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Can’t be crap under the smc, already replaced smc

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: 16V on pin 16 from U7200? PPBUS 12.6V? So, what is it then, both voltages should be the same....

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: 12.6V on pin 16 u7200  ppbus 12.60v

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: You saw the original water damage. The fact that it worked and then died usually point to a corroded resistor or corrosion under a chip. It all depends on where the corrosion was.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: While it was working i attempted a smc reset and thats when it died. Do I need to replace smc again?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: SMC_RESET will not hurt anything like that. It is corrosion under some chip or a corroded resistor/trace. Again, it all depends on where the corrosion was.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Can someone assist me with this board with more suggestions?  recap I have all power rails up to pp5v_s3. Dont have a short to ground pin 16 of u7200 is 12.60v

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Do you get any pulse at L7260, or other secondary supplies?
Apart of L7220, which must have stable 3V3...

Post SMC_ADAPTER_AN, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_SLP_SUS_L.
Check 32KHz clock to SMC.
Try to start shorting power pads (R5015/16) and check if PM_PWRBTN_L reacts.
PM_RSMRST_L should rise first.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
0.007V on l7260. doesnt move from there

SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V

0.427 32KHZ CLOCK pin 12  u2600

shorted pads and PM_PWRBTN_L didnt react

PM_RSMRST_L  didnt react

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_SUS_L"???

Check PPVRTC and all 4 (four) RTC signals.
SMC crystal Y5010 oscillates?
32KHz present at SMC input?
SMC_ONOFF_L is high?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V

RTC_RESET_L 3.482V

PCH_SRTCRST_L 0.412v

PCH_INTRUDER_L 3.199v

PCH_INTVRMEN_L 3.338V

Do not own a oscilloscope to check Y5010 oscillating

How do you check for 32KHz?

SMC_ONOFF_L 3.487V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
PCH_SRTCRST_L should be higher around 3.3V
Check if R1802 measure ok, hard for a 20 kohms to go high but still possible it happens. Check also if any corrosion underneath the resistor ( I mean corrosion on the pad). Check also C1802.
See if any short on pin 2 of R1802.

It could be a pch issue also... I had an smc with SMC_RESET_L low stuck at 1.4v, but no short at all, when I heated smc SMC_RESET_L went 3.3v and back to 1.4v when cold...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
"PCH_SRTCRST_L 0.412v"
PCH is kept in reset, no need to measure oscillation anymore.
C1802 is the first suspect here.
If not, bad PCH (hope not the case)...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Ok I have cleaned the pads up and replaced c1802 and r1802 but still same results. First time I have run into a board with this issue, however I have the ability to replace the pch. Does anything need to be done to the bios after pch is replaced?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Of course, new PCH requires clean ME region...

Did you check resistance to ground on PCH_SRTC_RST_L?
Check it again with removed PCH and compare values.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
PCH has been replaced.

PCH_SRTCRST_L is now 3.481V but still no fan spin. Is this because I need clean ME region?

resistance to ground without PCH 0.741 and with replacement PCH 0.406

Here is backup of bios [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xofkyYTHY-SzEwEGH1fF8qgOj-Xd8oMC/view?usp=sharing[/url]

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Secondary voltages should appear even without SPI chip soldered; less the CPU ones.
So, PM_SLP_S4_L should pulse at least; check that.

Post again all the signals mentioned in the previous posts...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_L does not pulse at all

PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V

RTC_RESET_L 3.482V

PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.481V

PCH_INTRUDER_L 3.195V

PCH_INTVRMEN_L 0V

SMC_ONOFF_L 3.487V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Noticed there was a short on PP5V_S5.

Soldered SPI chip back on for testing. Replaced U7801 and U7200 and now PM_SLP_S4_L is pulsing at 3.3V with a quarter fan spin every few seconds.

Do I just need new ME region now? If so can someone provide?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V"
PCH doesn't want to set it high.

And here is the reason.
"PCH_INTVRMEN_L 0V"
This signal should be high now, if machine tries to start.

"PM_SLP_S4_L is pulsing at 3.3V"
Check if all voltages controlled by it pulse too.
Do the same for PM_SLP_S3_L.
Also look if ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
suddenly lost my old voltages since I last checked this board. I have nothing for PM_SLP_S4_L now and no more quarter fan spin.

pp3v42 3.42 V but no green light PPBUS_G3H only 1.060V now

what to check next in this case?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
replaced q7085 now back to quarter fan spin

all voltages for PM_SLP_S4_L are pulsing along with PM_SLP_S3_L and ALL_SYS_PWRGD

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Do you note pulsing CPU coils too?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: cpu coils pulsing at 0.971V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: 25MHz oscillation tries to appear at pin9/U2600?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: I have the fluke 15b+ multimeter and I do not believe it supports MHz oscillation. Is there another way to check?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Try this as is; if works, then you may change the serial...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1RFRVA7vkn2gGPN7hpuXlNwLCIiMrNx5G[/url]

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Just tried it but nothing has changed. Anything else I can try?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Check if all the voltages from page 72 try to appear.
Also check all SPI termination resistors and traces around U6100.
